Work out the bearing of \(B\) from \(A\)

the smallest number

Two corresponding side lengths are \(3 \text{cm}\) and \(12 \text{cm}\)
The area of triangle \(T\) is \(5 \text{cm}^2\)
Find the area of triangle \(U\)

content.text: The diagram shows a solid cuboid with base area \(7 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
The volume of this cuboid is \(21 \mathrm{cm}^3\)
Work out the total surface area
Find the volume of a cylinder of radius \(5\mathrm{cm}\) and height \(8\mathrm{cm}\)
Give the units of your answer
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\)
\(AB\) is a chord of length \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
\(M\) is the mid-point of \(AB\) and \(OM = 4.5 \mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the radius of the circle
The diagram shows information about the first 8 seconds of a car journey
The car travels with constant acceleration reaching a speed of \(v \text{m/s}\) after 6 seconds
The car then travels at a constant speed of \(v \text{m/s}\) for a further 2 seconds
The car travels a total distance of 150 metres
Work out the value of \(v\)
Find a formula for \(d\) in terms of \(t\)
Calculate the distance the ball falls in 2 seconds

\(d\) is directly proportional to the square of \(t\)
The ball falls \(44.1 \text{m}\) in 3 seconds

Find the probability that both Raphael and Paulo pick a green pen
Box \(A\) and box \(B\) each contain blue and green pens only
Raphael picks a pen at random from box \(A\) and Paulo picks a pen at random from box \(B\)
The probability that Raphael picks a blue pen is \(\frac{2}{3}\)
The probability that both Raphael and Paulo pick a blue pen is \(\frac{8}{15}\)
